content.p: For each of the following parts, draw and clearly label a picture, and use that picture to find the exact values of the missing pieces of the right triangle. No squequals, please!
In a certain right triangle, one angle measures {{angle1A}} radians and {{sideA}} has length {{length1A}}. Find the exact measure of the non-right angle and the exact lengths of the other two sides.

In a given right triangle, {{side1B}} has length {{length1B}} and {{side2B}} has length {{length2B}}. Find the exact length of the remaining side and both exact and approximate measures of the two non-right angles (both in radians).

Consider the right triangle with hypotenuse {{hypC}}, horizontal leg {{adjC}}, and vertical leg {{oppC}}, with angle \theta opposite the vertical leg. How can we view {{v1}} as depending on {{v2}} only? How can we view {{v1}} as depending on \theta only?

outtro.p: The side adjacent to the given angle is {{adjA}}. The side opposite to the given angle is {{oppA}}. The hypotenuse is {{hypA}}. The other non-right angle is {{angle2A}}.
